Early diplomatic posts include services at the embassy in Mexico, Spain and the [MASK] embassy in Belgium.
He served as the Norwegian ambassador to CSCE from 1980 to 1988, to Spain from 1988 to 1992 and to [MASK] in Brussels from 1992 to 1998.

He was also a diplomat who served as ambassador to the United Kingdom (with concurrent accreditation in the Netherlands), to Spain and Portugal, to Nigeria (1971), to the United States (1971-1973 with concurrent accreditation in Canada, Mexico, Cuba, Brazil and Argentina), to Sweden (1973-1977 with concurrent accreditation in Finland and Austria) and to Belgium, Luxembourg, the European Union and [MASK] (1977-1979).
He was adviser Executive Cabinet Minister of Defence, Chief of Cabinet of the Secretary General of [MASK] and second in command at the Embassy of Spain in Italy.
